member.name: IMFMediaBuffer.GetCurrentLength
member.summary: Retrieves the length of the valid data in the buffer.
member.param: Receives the length of the valid data, in bytes. If the buffer does not contain any valid data, the value is zero.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFMediaBuffer.GetMaxLength
member.summary: Retrieves the allocated size of the buffer.
member.param: Receives the allocated size of the buffer, in bytes.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFMediaBuffer.Lock
member.summary: Gives the caller access to the memory in the buffer, for reading or writing
member.param: Receives a pointer to the start of the buffer.
Receives the maximum amount of data that can be written to the buffer. This parameter can be NULL. The same value is returned by the method.
Receives the length of the valid data in the buffer, in bytes. This parameter can be NULL. The same value is returned by the method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: For Direct3D surface buffers, an error occurred when locking the surface.
The buffer cannot be locked at this time.

member.name: IMFMediaBuffer.SetCurrentLength
member.summary: Sets the length of the valid data in the buffer.
member.param: Length of the valid data, in bytes. This value cannot be greater than the allocated size of the buffer, which is returned by the method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The specified length is greater than the maximum size of the buffer.

member.name: IMFMediaBuffer.Unlock
member.summary: Unlocks a buffer that was previously locked. Call this method once for every call to .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: For Direct3D surface buffers, an error occurred when unlocking the surface.

member.name: IMFMediaBuffer
member.summary: Represents a block of memory that contains media data. Use this interface to access the data in the buffer.
